qas.question: What Indian tribe was the Army's major campaign against?
During what years did the wars between the Army and the Seminoles take place?
What state were the Seminoles moved to?
What did the Army traditionally take control of to defeat the Indians?
During what century did the Seminoles enter Florida?

context: The army's major campaign against the Indians was fought in Florida against <a0_0><b5_0>Seminoles<b5_0/><a0_0/>. It took long wars (<a1_0><b6_0>1818–58<b6_0/><a1_0/>) to finally defeat the Seminoles and move them to <a2_0><b7_0>Oklahoma<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The usual strategy in Indian wars was to seize control of the Indians <a3_0><b8_0>winter food supply<b8_0/><a3_0/>, but that was no use in Florida where there was no winter. The second strategy was to form alliances with other Indian tribes, but that too was useless because the Seminoles had destroyed all the other Indians when they entered Florida in the late <a4_0><b9_0>eighteenth<b9_0/><a4_0/> century.
